isis.stitle: 13 SPEED AND 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-713/18 SERIES - ASSEMBLE - COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

note.para: Except for the PTO gears, the upper and lower countershaft assemblies are the same. To avoid confusion during installation, mark the upper countershaft (45-tooth PTO gear) with a "U". The lower countershaft has a 47-tooth PTO gear.

step1.para: If previously removed, install the keys in each countershaft keyway ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Install Keys in Countershaft Keyways

step1.para: Align 2nd speed gear keyway with the countershaft key, long hub to countershaft front, and press the gear on the countershaft ( Figure 146).

figure.caption: Figure 146. Align 2nd Speed Gear Keyway With Countershaft Key

step1.para: Align 3rd speed gear keyway with the countershaft key, long hub against 2nd speed gear, and press the gear on the countershaft ( Figure 147).

figure.caption: Figure 147. Align 3rd Speed Gear Keyway With Countershaft Key

step1.para: Align 4th speed gear keyway with the countershaft key, long hub to the countershaft front, and press the gear on the countershaft ( Figure 148).

figure.caption: Figure 148. Align 4th Speed Gear Keyway With Countershaft Key

step1.para: Align PTO gear keyway with the countershaft key, bullet nose of teeth facing up (shaft rear). Align drive gear keyway with the countershaft key, long hub against PTO gear, and press both gears on the countershaft ( Figure 149).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Align PTO Gear Keyway With Countershaft Key

step1.para: Install the drive gear retaining snap ring in the groove on each countershaft front ( Figure 150).

figure.caption: Figure 150. Install Drive Gear Retaining Snap Ring

step1.para: Use a flanged driver or the press to install the bearing inner race on the countershaft front against the drive gear ( Figure 151).
